name: mkal
description: Makes an alias for the present working directory

scripts.preinstall: echo alias mkal=\"source mkal\" #this was included due to mkal install>> ~/.bash_profile
scripts.postinstall:
echo '################################## 
In order for mkal to work for the first time
Please run the following code in your command line: . ~/.bash_profile
##################################

Using mkal: Go to a directory and type: mkal <shortcut name>
Later, you can type <shortcut name> from any location to return to that directory
'

author: Adam Ellsworth and Trevor Hanus
